lines.text: [Sy Lerner interrupts Johnny Depp and Jim Jarmusch while they are meditating in order to pitch them a film]
This is a very spiritual film. This is a film written by a poet, whose father was a poet, one of the great American cowboy poets.

[to Jim Jarmusch]
And in fact, this is the kind of film that you would be perfect to direct. Now I don't know if you could handle a budget that big, 25 million, 'cause you're not used to working with that...
Hey, I could handle any budget - 100 million - but I'm on a level above the earth right now. I'm interested in spiritual...
We're floating. Right now, we're floating. Jim and I are above you.
Since 'HandGun' and this picture...
Yeah...
I've seen you come alive as an actor again. You were dying on TV. I'm glad you got out of that, shit.
Ha! Ha! Ha!
It's true, you?
I know.
So you got some money. You can be comfortable now. But I've got the part for you. 'Cannes Man' written by Frank Rhino.
Oh, Sy, Sy, Are you gonna pitch something to me now? I'm not gonna...
I'm gonna tell you. Malkovich, he wants to do it. Malkovich has signed to do it. Hopper's signed to do it. Not to act, though, thank God, I think I'm gonna let him direct it... Treat.
Can I just read it, please?
I love you more than any actor I know. I wouldn't offer this part to anybody else. I don't give a shit who wants it.
I'll read the script, Sy, okay?
If Brando got skinny, I wouldn't give it to him.
Okay, let me read the script, okay?
This is your part. Alright.
Could I just read it? I'll read the script. I mean, could I...? Is it ready?
You want to meet the guy?
With all due respect, could I...? Could I read it?
You can read it. Rhino is the hottest male writer since Hemingway. Speaking of Faulkner.
